      • toSQL

        public java.lang.String toSQL()
        toSQL returns a static string version of the query with runtime variables properly encoded. This method is also useful when combined with the where clause methods like isParameter() or atLeastParameter() which allows iciql to generate re-usable parameterized string statements.
        Returns:
        the sql query as plain text

      • toSQL

        public java.lang.String toSQL(boolean distinct)
        toSQL returns a static string version of the query with runtime variables properly encoded. This method is also useful when combined with the where clause methods like isParameter() or atLeastParameter() which allows iciql to generate re-usable parameterized string statements.
        Parameters:
        distinct - if true SELECT DISTINCT is used for the query
        Returns:
        the sql query as plain text

      • toSQL

        public <K> java.lang.String toSQL(boolean distinct,
                         K k)
        toSQL returns a static string version of the query with runtime variables properly encoded. This method is also useful when combined with the where clause methods like isParameter() or atLeastParameter() which allows iciql to generate re-usable parameterized string statements.
        Parameters:
        distinct - if true SELECT DISTINCT is used for the query
        k - k is used to select only the columns of the specified alias for an inner join statement. An example of a generated statement is: SELECT DISTINCT t1.* FROM sometable AS t1 INNER JOIN othertable AS t2 ON t1.id = t2.id WHERE t2.flag = true without the alias parameter the statement would start with SELECT DISTINCT * FROM...
        Returns:
        the sql query as plain text

      • appendSQL

        public void appendSQL(SQLStatement stat,
             java.lang.Object alias,
             java.lang.Object valueLeft,
             java.lang.Object valueRight,
             com.iciql.CompareType compareType)
        INTERNAL
        Parameters:
        stat - the statement
        alias - the alias object (can be null)
        valueLeft - the value on the left of the compound clause
        valueRight - the value on the right of the compound clause
        compareType - the current compare type (e.g. BETWEEN)
